vote.title: To honor, recognize, and celebrate the life of the Reverend Dr. Jefferey P. Kee, 1961-2024
vote.description:
Title
 
To honor, recognize, and celebrate the life of the Reverend Dr. Jefferey P. Kee, 1961-2024
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, the Reverend Dr. Jefferey P. Kee, “pastor for the master,” was born on August 5th, 1961 to his late parents, James and Johnnie Mae Kee; and
 
WHEREAS, the Rev. Dr. Kee was a prolific and deeply loved faith leader, serving for nearly 35 years at New Faith Baptist Church of Christ as senior pastor, who was known as a funny, wise, down-to-earth friend and confidant by the community, growing the size of his congregation and significantly expanding the physical and spiritual presence of New Faith Baptist in Columbus; and
 
WHEREAS, the Rev. Dr. Knee was towering figure in the Columbus social justice community, emphasizing the inseparable link between faith and justice, helping found the interfaith community organization B.R.E.A.D (Building Responsibility Equality And Dignity) as well as leading the Area Religious Coalition, both dedicated to combating all forms of injustice; and
WHEREAS, the Rev. Dr. Kee was deeply loved by his congregation and the entire faith and social justice community and embodied his faith in every aspect of his life, cultivating the next generation of city leaders and leaving a legacy of spiritual stewardship; and
WHEREAS, the City of Columbus extends its sincere condolences to the friends and family of the Reverend Dr. Jefferey P. Kee, including his daughter, Jazmine M. Kee-Lovette; fiancée, Monique Smoot; siblings, Jennifer, Jacquelyn, Jameel, James, and Joreece Kee, and countless other family members, friends, faith leaders, and loved ones across Columbus and beyond; now, therefore,
 
BE IT RESOLVED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS: That this Council does hereby honor, recognize, and celebrate the life of the Reverend Dr. Jefferey P. Kee.
